Description: Stamp (vessel): quarter-qisṭ. Nine line Kufic inscription and a 6 pointed star above the end of the third line. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Petrie, W.M.F. 1926. ‘Glass stamps and weights’. London, 127; Miles, G.C. 1948. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps’. New York, 36; Launois, Aimée. 1959. ‘Estampilles et poids musulmans en verre du Cabinet des Médailles’ II. Cairo, 9; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York, 199. Cf. Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 70-81; Miles, G.C. 1958. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ I. New York, 62; Balog 1976, 200-2.
The denomination is simply written rubʿ (quarter), instead of the usual rubʿ qisṭ.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (97)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Ẓaffār b. Shabba
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
